Description: Sherd of Clazomenian black-figure pottery amphora. Body, tongues, scales, dividing band of alternate dots; nude and bearded komasts, confronted, dancing, six figures in total: on dark paint two narrow bands of purple. Purple for hair and some beards. White for dots of scales.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 29
Curator's comments: Philadelphia E. 147.2 and 43, with similar scales, may be from this or GR 1888.2-8.77a (CVA BM 8, pl. GB 586, 3-4 ). Petrie 1888, pl. xxx, 2. BMC B.108. JdI 1895, 43 fig. 6. BSA xlvii, 128-B.11.
Findspot number '29' and ''Case 23" pencilled on the item.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B108)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 586, 1-2)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 62 § 59, pl. xxx, 2)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 109)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.211)
